main event: Multiple civilians reported seeing unidentified lights in the sky over Easton and Westfield, Maine, on several occasions between 23 February and 7 February 1953.
interesting points: The lights were described as reddish-orange, maneuvering in a controlled manner, and flickering at times., The sightings lasted approximately 3 minutes and involved consistent movement patterns., Two observers confirmed the sighting, stating it appeared larger and brighter than stars., Weather conditions were clear during the sightings, allowing for good visibility., There was no physical evidence found related to the sightings.
sighted object: Unidentified lights in the sky, reported circular in shape
